definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: That class increased her accomplishments as a pianist.
sentences.chinese: 那個培訓班增長了她作爲鋼琴師的技藝。

sentences.english: ''The Legend of 1900'' is at least gorgeous to look at.
sentences.chinese: 當然《海上鋼琴師》至少乍看還是炫目的。

sentences.english: The pianist's execution of the concerto was marvellous.
sentences.chinese: 那鋼琴師彈的協奏曲神乎其技。

sentences.english: Please do not shoot the pianist. He is doing his best.
sentences.chinese: 請別開槍打死那個鋼琴師，他已經盡力了。

sentences.english: The pianist pounded out the tune with great effort.
sentences.chinese: 鋼琴師用了很大氣力才彈奏出這個調子。

sentences.english: I got the pianist from the genie".
sentences.chinese: 我從妖精那裏得到小鋼琴師的”。

sentences.english: The piano concerto was well rendered.
The pianist played the happy pair out with the wedding March.
sentences.chinese: 鋼琴師彈奏結婚進行曲送走這幸福的一對。

sentences.english: At that time, I dreamed of being a pianist and having my own piano.
sentences.chinese: 那時，我就夢想有一架自己的鋼琴，成爲一名鋼琴師。

sentences.english: So, the bartender wants to know where the guy found the small pianist.
sentences.chinese: 於是，調酒師想知道這個人從哪裏找到的小鋼琴師。

definition: Les Misérables (1862) by Victor Hugo 維克多·雨果|维克多·雨果[Wei2 ke4 duo1 · Yu3 guo3]
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
pingshu, a folk art where a single performer narrates stories from history or fiction
lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
